message.content:
cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.NA, cs.SI. 

The paper deals with the use of Total variation (TV) minimization in the recovery of a given gradient sparse vector from Gaussian linear measurements. This problem is related to signal processing, image processing, and compressed sensing, which are all subfields of computer science. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.IT (Information Theory). 

The paper also discusses the phase transition behavior of TV minimization, which is a topic related to statistical learning theory and optimization. Therefore, the paper may also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.NA (Numerical Analysis). 

Moreover, the paper mentions the application of TV minimization in image processing, which suggests that it may also belong to cs.CV (Computer Vision). 

Finally, the paper presents a novel upper-bound that approximates the TV phase transition curve, which is a topic related to mathematical analysis and optimization. Therefore, the paper may also belong to cs.SI (Systems and Control).
